actions.committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

official_title: A bill to amend the Public Health Service Act to unify the reauthorization cycle with respect to Centers for Disease Control and Prevention programs, and for other purposes.
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text: CDC Reauthorization Unification Act of 1993 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to provide that the authorization of appropriaitons for the following Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) programs shall extend only through FY 1995, as opposed to the current authorizations which run through either FY 1996 or FY 1997: (1) Lead Poisoning Prevention; (2) Prostate Cancer Prevention; (3) Cancer Registries; (4) Health Promotion and Disease Prevention Research and Demonstration Centers; and (5) Prevntive Health and Health Services Block Grants. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) CDC programs should be authorized only through FY 1995; and (2) beginning in FY 1995 all CDC programs should be reauthorized into one comprehensive Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Public Health Service Act to unify the reauthorization cycle with respect to Centers for Disease Control and Prevention programs, and for other purposes.
